definition: to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until

sentences.english: His smile spread out to his cars again, and he headed for the checkouts .
sentences.chinese: 他又咧開嘴笑了，趕快奔向收款臺。

sentences.english: He hurried behind the other Blue Team members to get aboard their own transport.
sentences.chinese: 他也趕快緊隨其他藍隊成員登上他們自己的飛行器。

sentences.english: Little red hat hurried to put a big stone into the wolf's belly.
sentences.chinese: 小紅帽趕快去找來大石頭填到狼的肚子裏去。

sentences.english: So everyone's freaking out. And insisting I go get vaccinated.
sentences.chinese: 所以這把所有人都嚇壞了，他們都讓我趕快去打疫苗。

sentences.english: Yeah. I can't wait to get some fresh feta cheese.
sentences.chinese: 對啊，我好想趕快喫到新鮮的羊乳酪。

sentences.english: They were runing from the police like all get-out .
sentences.chinese: 孩子們一看見警察就趕快溜走了。

sentences.english: Please hurry up the dispatch of these telegrams.
sentences.chinese: 請趕快將這些電報發出去。

sentences.english: We must return to Solace quickly.
sentences.chinese: 我們得趕快回到索拉斯。

sentences.english: I would rather you posted this letter right away.
sentences.chinese: 我倒希望你把這封信趕快寄走。

sentences.english: Hurry up, or you'll miss the early bus.
sentences.chinese: 趕快，否則你就趕不上早班車。

sentences.english: Run for the doctor,the old man is dying.
sentences.chinese: 這個老頭兒不行了，趕快去找醫生。

sentences.english: We quickly pulled the moon Come.
sentences.chinese: 我們趕快把月亮撈上來吧。

sentences.english: You’ll be late unless you hurry.
sentences.chinese: 你會遲到的，如果不趕快的話。

sentences.english: I think you have to prepare for his funeral.
sentences.chinese: 我看你趕快準備後事吧。

sentences.english: But, uh, we better get home before our families wake up.
sentences.chinese: 不過我們最好趁着家人還沒醒趕快回去。

definition: to do sth more quickly/Hurry up!/Get a move on!
at once/right away/immediately/on horseback (i.e. by military force)
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
preparation/to prepare/to intend/to be about to/reserve (fund)
to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until
to help/to assist/to support/for sb (i.e. as a help)/hired (as worker)/side (of pail, boat etc)/outer layer/upper (of a shoe)/group/gang/clique/party/secret society
to come over/to manage/to handle/to be able to take care of
to help/to lend a hand/to do a favor/to do a good turn
